item.title: 彭博社报道：软银和 Arm 考虑收购 Ampere Computing
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，日本科技投资商软银集团公司及其控股的 Arm Holdings Plc 正在探讨收购由前英特尔高管领导的半导体公司 Ampere Computing。【原文：Japanese technology investor SoftBank Group Corp and its majority-owned Arm Holdings Plc are exploring a deal for Ampere Computing, a semiconductor firm headed by ex-Intel executives, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国码头工人与港口雇主达成临时协议
item.description: 美国海运联盟（United States Maritime Alliance）周三表示，它与国际码头工人协会（International Longshoremen's Association）就一份为期 6 年的新总合同达成了临时协议。【原文：United States Maritime Alliance said on Wednesday it reached a tentative agreement on a new 6-year master contract with the International Longshoremen's Association.】

item.title: 花旗计划为特朗普就职典礼捐款，具体数额未透露
item.description: 据一位熟知内情的人士透露，华尔街巨头花旗集团计划向当选总统唐纳德-特朗普的就职典礼基金捐献一笔尚未披露的款项，加入美国银行和高盛等主要贷款机构的行列。【原文：Wall Street giant Citigroup plans to contribute an as-yet undisclosed sum to President-elect Donald Trump's inauguration fund, according to a person familiar with the matter, joining fellow major lenders Bank of America and Goldman Sachs .】

item.title: 洛克希德-马丁公司 2024 年交付 110 架 F-35 战斗机
item.description: 总部位于马里兰州贝塞斯达的防务承包商洛克希德-马丁公司周三在一份声明中说，该公司将在2024年向美国及其盟国交付总共110架F-35战斗机。【原文：Lockheed Martin delivered a total of 110 F-35 fighter jets to the United States and its allies in 2024, the Bethesda, Maryland-based defense contractor said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 沃尔沃首席执行官表示，尽管面临美国关税威胁，但墨西哥卡车工厂计划仍在进行中
item.description: 瑞典沃尔沃集团（Volvo Group）首席执行官马丁-伦德施泰特（Martin Lundstedt）周三告诉路透社记者，尽管美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）威胁要对进口汽车和其他商品征收关税，但沃尔沃集团仍在继续推进其计划在墨西哥蒙特雷建造的价值 7 亿美元的重型卡车工厂。【原文：Sweden's Volvo Group is proceeding with its planned $700-million heavy-truck factory in Monterrey, Mexico, CEO Martin Lundstedt told Reuters on Wednesday, even as President-elect Donald Trump threatens to impose U.S. tariffs on imports of vehicles and other goods.】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火经济损失估计高达 500 亿美元
item.description: 美国私营预报机构 AccuWeather 周三表示，加州野火已经是历史上最严重的野火之一，初步估计造成的破坏和经济损失超过 500 亿美元。【原文：U.S. private forecaster AccuWeather said on Wednesday that estimated damage and economic loss from the California wildfire, already one of the worst in history, is over $50 billion at a preliminary level.】

item.title: 人工智能需求增长，Vanguard 集团增持 Talen Energy 股份至 10.4
item.description: 根据周三提交的一份文件，美国资产管理公司先锋集团（Vanguard Group）将其在独立电力生产商塔伦能源公司（Talen Energy Corp）的持股比例增至 10.4%。【原文：U.S. asset management firm Vanguard Group increased its stake in independent power producer Talen Energy Corp to 10.4%, according to a filing on Wednesday.】

item.title: 股东敦促 UnitedHealth 分析医疗拒绝的影响
item.description: 联合健康集团（UnitedHealth Group）的股东们周三表示，他们要求该公司就其 "限制或延迟获得医疗服务的做法 "的相关成本和对公众健康的影响编写一份报告。【原文：UnitedHealth Group shareholders on Wednesday said they requested the company prepare a report on the costs and public health impact related to its "practices that limit or delay access to healthcare."】

item.title: 沃尔沃集团计划中的瑞典工厂将推迟电池厂生产
item.description: 沃尔沃集团首席执行官马丁-伦德施泰特（Martin Lundstedt）周三在拉斯维加斯消费电子展（CES）期间举行的路透社 NEXT 新闻人物活动上表示，沃尔沃集团预计计划中的瑞典电池厂的大批量生产将比原定目标（2029-2030 年）晚几年开始。【原文：Volvo Group expects high-volume production of a planned battery plant in Sweden to begin a couple of years later than the original target of 2029-2030, CEO Martin Lundstedt said at a Reuters NEXT Newsmaker event at CES in Las Vegas on Wednesday.】

item.title: 当地媒体称，巴西 Azul 航空公司正逐步接近与 Gol 航空公司合并
item.description: 据《Valor Economico》周三报道，巴西 Azul 航空公司预计将在未来几周内与竞争对手 Gol 航空公司的母公司 Abra 签署一份谅解备忘录，以促成 Azul 和 Gol 的潜在合并。【原文：Brazilian airline Azul is expected to sign in the next few weeks a memorandum of understandings with rival carrier Gol's parent Abra for a potential merger between Azul and Gol, newspaper Valor Economico reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 拉扎德报告称，美国激进分子的要求推高了股价，但也许不会持续太久
item.description: 投资银行拉扎德（Lazard）的最新数据显示，在要求宣布后的几天内，这些企业的要求会带来相当可观的市场指数涨幅。【原文：Demands by U.S. activist investors can send a target company's stock surging, and new data from investment bank Lazard show that these corporate nudges generate considerable market index-beating gains in the days after demands are announced.】

item.title: 早间新闻全球债券动荡，中国通胀回落
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 杰富瑞因投资银行业务意外之财，利润增长两倍多
item.description: 杰富瑞金融公司（Jefferies Financial）周三公布第四季度利润增长超过三倍，原因是该投资银行从交易咨询中获得了更高的费用，而且承销活动依然强劲。【原文：Jefferies Financial reported an over three-fold rise in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday as the investment bank earned higher fees from deal advisory and underwriting activity remained strong.】

item.title: 消息人士称，摩根士丹利将 173 名员工提升为董事总经理
item.description: 一位接近此事的消息人士周三告诉路透社，华尔街巨头摩根士丹利今年提拔了 173 名员工担任董事总经理，比 2024 年增加了 12%。【原文：Wall Street giant Morgan Stanley promoted 173 of its employees to managing director roles this year, marking a 12% increase from 2024, a source close to the matter told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 独家报道文件显示，2024年智利Codelco公司的铜产量将增至13.28亿吨
item.description: 据路透社周三看到的一份内部文件显示，世界上最大的红色金属生产商智利国家铜业公司（Codelco）去年的铜产量达到了 132.8 万公吨。【原文：Copper production from Chile's Codelco, the world's largest producer of the red metal, reached 1.328 million metric tons last year, according to an internal document seen by Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 报道称好时寻求美国商品期货交易委员会批准购买超过允许数量的 ICE 可可豆
item.description: 周三的一份报告称，巧克力生产商好时公司已向美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）申请许可，从ICE交易所的股票中购买可可，购买量远远超过了允许的上限。【原文：Chocolate maker Hershey Co has requested permission from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) to buy an amount of cocoa from the stocks of ICE exchange that is much larger than the maximum allowed, a report said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 国债收益率上升促使美国企业发行更多债券
item.description: 周三，美国企业债务市场继续有新债券发行，原因是国债收益率上升增加了对债务的需求，促使企业在借贷成本进一步上升之前立即完成融资。【原文：U.S. corporate debt markets continued to be peppered by new bond offerings on Wednesday as rising Treasury yields increased demand for debt and pushed companies to get their funding done now before any further increase in borrowing costs.】

item.title: 法官批准特斯拉董事结束超额薪酬案的协议
item.description: 特斯拉董事长罗宾-登霍尔姆（Robyn Denholm）和詹姆斯-默多克（James Murdoch）等特斯拉董事周三获得法院批准，达成一项价值高达 9.19 亿美元的和解协议，要求他们向汽车制造商退还赔偿金，以解决他们被指控超额支付薪酬的问题。【原文：Tesla directors including Chair Robyn Denholm and James Murdoch got court approval on Wednesday for a settlement worth up to $919 million that requires they return compensation to the carmaker to resolve allegations they overpaid themselves.】

item.title: 美联储会议纪要显示华尔街推迟了资产负债表缩减的预期结束时间
item.description: 根据美联储最近一次政策会议的会议纪要，华尔街最大的银行已经推迟了美联储缩减资产负债表规模的预期结局。【原文：Wall Street's biggest banks have pushed back the expected endgame for the Federal Reserve's ongoing efforts to shrink the size of its balance sheet, according to meeting minutes for the Federal Reserve's most recent policy meeting.】

item.title: 谷歌必须面对手机隐私集体诉讼和可能的审判
item.description: 谷歌未能说服联邦法官驳回一项隐私权集体诉讼，该诉讼声称谷歌在人们关闭停止跟踪的按钮后收集了他们手机中的个人数据。【原文：Google failed to persuade a federal judge to dismiss a privacy class action claiming it collected personal data from people's cellphones after they switched off a button to stop the tracking, paving the way for a possible August trial.】

item.title: 摩根大通对希腊 Viva Wallet 提起两起诉讼，法律纠纷仍在继续
item.description: 华尔街银行摩根大通（JP Morgan）就其对金融科技公司 Viva Wallet 的投资提起了两起诉讼，这是双方就如何评估希腊企业价值的法律纠纷的最新进展。【原文：Wall Street bank JP Morgan has filed two lawsuits over its investment in fintech Viva Wallet, the latest twist in a legal dispute between the two sides over how to value the Greek business.】

item.title: EIA数据显示，美国从加拿大的石油进口量在关税威胁前创下新高
item.description: 美国能源信息署（EIA）周三的数据显示，在美国新任总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）计划对加拿大进口商品征收25%的关税之前，美国上周从加拿大进口的原油增至历史最高水平。【原文：U.S. crude oil imports from Canada rose last week to the highest on record, data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) showed on Wednesday, ahead of incoming U.S. president Donald Trump's plans to levy a 25% tariff on Canadian imports.】

item.title: 独家消息消息人士称，华平投资集团正在探索以 50 多亿美元的价格出售 "现代化医学 "公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司华平投资（Warburg Pincus）正在权衡包括出售 Modernizing Medicine (ModMed) 在内的各种选择，该医疗软件供应商的估值可能超过 50 亿美元（包括债务）。【原文：Private equity firm Warburg Pincus is weighing options, including a sale, for Modernizing Medicine (ModMed) that could value the medical software provider at more than $5 billion, including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 国债收益率飙升反映了对更多长期债务的预期
item.description: 交易员们表示，较长期的美国国债收益率已飙升至数月高点，超过了较短期国债收益率的涨幅，其中一些差异反映出人们预期即将上任的特朗普政府将需要改变目前更多地依赖短期债务的做法。【原文：Longer-term U.S. Treasury yields have surged to multi-month highs, outpacing a rise in shorter-dated yields, with some of the disparity reflecting anticipation that the incoming Trump administration will need to change the current focus on relying more on short-term debt, traders say.】

item.title: 行业组织就拜登禁止在信用报告中提及医疗债务一事提起诉讼
item.description: 代表信用报告和信用社行业的两个团体提起诉讼，对美国总统乔-拜登即将卸任的政府通过的禁止将医疗债务纳入美国消费者信用报告的新规定提出质疑。【原文：Two groups representing the credit reporting and credit union industries have filed a lawsuit challenging a new rule adopted by U.S. President Joe Biden's outgoing administration banning the inclusion of medical debt in American consumers' credit reports.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，亿万富翁莱昂-布莱克（Leon Black）正在洽谈收购《每日电讯报》事宜
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）联合创始人兼前首席执行官莱昂-布莱克（Leon Black）正在洽谈成为收购《每日电讯报》的主要投资者。【原文：Leon Black, co-founder and former CEO of Apollo Global Management , is in talks to become the anchor investor in the acquisition of the Telegraph, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴西检察官就事实核查计划的变化质询美达公司
item.description: 巴西检察官周三命令社交媒体平台 Meta 澄清其最近宣布的对美国事实核查计划的修改是否也适用于南美国家。【原文：Brazilian prosecutors on Wednesday ordered that social media platform Meta clarify whether recently announced changes to its fact-checking program in the United States will also be applied to the South American country.】

item.title: 耶伦称美国外国投资委员会对美国钢铁公司与新日本钢铁公司受阻的合并案进行了 "透彻的分析
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）周三表示，新日铁对美国钢铁公司（U.S. Steel）的收购受阻已得到一个跨部门国家安全审查机构的 "全面分析"，该机构已将分析报告送交乔-拜登总统。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said on Wednesday that Nippon Steel's blocked acquisition of U.S. Steel received a "thorough analysis" by an interagency national security review body that was sent to President Joe Biden.】

item.title: 美国 11 月批发库存降幅未修正为 0.2
item.description: 11 月份美国批发库存下降了 0.2%，与上个月的初步估计相同，原因是汽车和计算机设备等长寿命制成品的库存急剧下降。【原文：U.S. wholesale inventories fell 0.2% in November, as initially estimated last month, amid sharp declines in stocks of long-lasting manufactured goods like motor vehicles and computer equipment.】

item.title: 埃克森石油第四季度盈利疲软，炼油业务受挤压，股价下滑
item.description: 埃克森美孚（Exxon Mobil）股价在周三早盘交易中下跌近 2%，原因是这家美国最大的石油生产商警告称，第四季度炼油利润下降，整个业务回报率疲软。【原文：Exxon Mobil shares fell nearly 2% in early trading on Wednesday after the top U.S. oil producer warned of a decline in refining profits in the fourth quarter and weak returns across its operations.】
